string-array.name: pes_descriptions_full
string-array.item: Building with earth on the roof and against three walls. Directional effects through the door and headwall are away from the Exposed Site.
Building with earth on the roof and against three walls. Directional effects through the door and headwall are perpendicular to the direction of an ES.
Building with earth on the roof and against three walls. Directional effects through the door and headwall are towards an Exposed Site.
Building of non-combustible construction with walls of nominal 450 mm RC (680 mm brick or equivalent) and protective roof of 150 mm RC with suitable support.
Building of non-combustible construction with walls of nominal 450 mm RC (680 mm brick or equivalent) and protective roof of 150 mm RC with suitable support. Door or other large aperture faces an ES.
Building of non-combustible construction with walls of nominal 450 mm RC (680 mm brick or equivalent) without a protective roof. Integrated Weapons Complex.
Building constructed with walls of 215 mm brick (or equivalent) and protective roof of 150 mm concrete with suitable support, traversed.
Building constructed with walls of 215 mm brick (or equivalent) and protective roof of 150 mm concrete with suitable support, untraversed.
Open-air stack or light structure, traversed. Truck, trailer, rail-car or freight container loaded with ammunition, traversed.
Open-air stack or light structure, untraversed. Truck, trailer, rail-car or freight container loaded with ammunition, untraversed.

string-array.name: es_descriptions_short
string-array.item: Process Building with protective roof - traversed
Process Building without protective roof - traversed
Inhabited Building or Places of Assembly

string-array.name: es_descriptions_long
string-array.item: Standard UK Igloo designed in accordance with Chapter 6, with the door facing away from PES.
Standard UK Igloo designed in accordance with Chapter 6, with the door facing perpendicularly to the direction of PES.
Standard UK Igloo designed in accordance with Chapter 6, with the door towards a PES.
Earth-covered building not complying with Chapter 6, but with a headwall and door(s) resistant to high velocity projections (see Chapter 10 Section 2). The door faces a PES
Earth-covered building not complying with Chapter 6, but with a door barricade, (see Chapter 10 Section 2). The door faces a PES.

Earth-covered building not complying with Chapter 6, with or without a headwall and door(s) resistant to fire and low velocity projections, (see Chapter 10 Section 2), but the door faces away from a PES.

Earth-covered building not complying with Chapter 6, with or without a headwall and door(s) resistant to fire and low velocity projections, (see Chapter 10 Section 2), but the door faces perpendicularly to the direction of a PES.
Earth-covered building not complying with Chapter 6, with or without a headwall and door(s) resistant to fire and low velocity projections, (see Chapter 10 Section 2), with the door facing a PES
Building of noncombustible construction with walls of nominal 450 mm RC (680 mm brick or equivalent) and protective roof of 150 mm RC with suitable support. The door is traversed if it faces a PES.
Building of noncombustible construction with walls of nominal 450 mm RC (680 mm brick or equivalent), without a protective roof. The door is traversed if it faces a PES.
Open air stack or light structure, traversed. Truck, trailer, rail-car or freight container loaded with ammunition, traversed
Open air stack or light structure, untraversed. Truck, trailer, rail-car or freight container loaded with ammunition, untraversed.
Building constructed with walls of 215 mm brick (or equivalent) and protective roof of 150 mm concrete with suitable support, traversed.
Building constructed with walls of 215 mm brick (or equivalent) and protective roof of 150 mm concrete with suitable support, untraversed.
Process Building with protective roof, traversed
Process Building without protective roof, traversed
Process Building with or without protective roof, untraversed
Transfer Shed Traversed. Occupied by less than 10 persons
Transfer Shed Traversed. Occupied by 10 or more persons
Transfer Shed Untraversed. Occupied by less than 10 persons
Transfer Shed Untraversed. Occupied by 10 or more persons

Low Density Usage Roads – Less than 1000 vehicles per day. Railways – Less than 1000 passengers per day. Waterways – Less than 400 users per day. Public Rights of Way or Recreational Facilities – Less than 200 users per day

Medium Density Usage Roads – 1000 or more but less than 5000 vehicles per day. Railways – 1000 or more but less than 5000 passengers per day. Waterways – 400 or more but less than 1800 users per day. Public Rights of Way or Recreational Facilities – 200 or more but less than 900 users per day

High Density Usage Roads – 5000 or more vehicles per day. Railways – 5000 or more passengers per day. Waterways – 1800 or more users per day. Public Rights of Way or Recreational Facilities – 900 or more users per day
Inhabited Building or Places of Assembly
Office, Non-explosives workshop, Canteen with less than 20 persons who are directly associated with the explosives task in a support role
Office, Non-explosives workshop, Canteen with 20 or more persons who are directly associated with the explosives task in a support role
Office or Amenity Changing facility used by Explosives Workers or EASW
Overhead Power Grid - Supergrid Network and associated substations
Overhead Power Grid - Normal Network and associated substations
Overhead Power Grid - Minor Network and associated substations
POL Facilities inc pipelines - Protected or Underground
POL Facilities inc pipelines - Unprotected, aboveground vital
POL Facilities inc pipelines - Unprotected, aboveground, non-vital
POL Facilities inc pipelines - Small Quantities
